line_1: But yet no Baptist Boar, nor foaming Bear can graze,
line_2: Nor one Immortal Hind in all the Place.

line_1: Sent myne Poetic Herd to graze.
line_2: Certes, I have these many Days

line_1: Whilst near its grassy banks the herd shall graze,
line_2: How should I love to mark that riv'let's maze,

line_1: In which One single Ewe did sport and graze:
line_2: A Field of small Extent surrounds the Place,

line_1: Their wanton goats o'er all my vineyards graze,
line_2: Perpetual torments of my harassed days:

line_1: For satire's shots but slightly graze;
But with the down-look'd Herd unminded Graze.
line_2: How brutish then must be that grovelling Race,

line_1: But with the down-look'd Herd unminded Graze.
line_2: That to bright knowledge ne'er erect their Face,

line_1: Where all, intent, the luscious Herbage graze;
line_2: And, for that Day, their Pasture seems to please:

line_1: Though on my grave the senseless herd should graze.
line_2: Nor let this scene a pensive murmur raise,

line_2: Exempt from future service all his days,

line_1: Down the rich pasture heedlessly they graze,
line_2: Or hear the summon with an idle gaze;

line_1: And the hot cattle startling cease to graze;
line_2: But now the sun sends forth his scorching rays,
